intro: Acronia tuberculosa, commonly known as the roughleaf acronia, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its stems are often hairy and have a distinct tuberculate texture, giving it its scientific name. Acronia tuberculosa is typically found in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade.
